page.title: 01DIDCOT'S HISTORY
page.content: INITIALLY A ROMANO-BRITISH SETTLEMENT, DIDCOT APPEARS IN THE DOMESDAY BOOK OF 1086 AS WIBALDESTON.IT WAS OWNED BETWEEN 1317 AND 1671 BY THE STONORS,WHO ENCLOSED THE LAND TO THE NORTH .THEY WERE FAMOUS CATHOLIC RECUSANTS.DAVID OF UFFINGTON,ONE OF THE FIGURES ON WHICH THE LEGENDARY ROBIN HOOD IS BASED,HELD THE MANOR IN THE THIRTEENTH CENTURY,AND ROBERT WINTOUR,A GUNPOWDER PLOTTER,HELD A MORTGAGE ON IT IN THE SEVENTEENTH CENTURY.THE RAILWAY WAS LAID IN 1839,LEADING TO THE TOWN'S EXPANSION.C.1920 THE BROADWAY WAS ESTABLISHED AS THE TOWN CENTRE.HOUSING ESTATES WERE STARTED IN 1928,1950 AND ARE STILL BEING ADDED.THERE IS AN ARMY BARRACKS.THE POWER STATION WAS BUILT C.1960.BY 1991 POPULATION MAY NUMBER 25,000.
